intro: Crotalaria filicaulis var. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered crown flower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features palmately compound leaves with three to five leaflets and produces showy, yellow to orange flowers with a distinctive crown-like structure. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant blooms and is also used in traditional medicine in some cultures. The species is adapted to well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it suitable for gardens and landscapes in warm climates.
